mckay.utilities.sound.midi

Class MidiBuildEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • mckay.utilities.sound.midi.MidiBuildEvent

  • public class MidiBuildEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    This class builds and returns MidiEvent objects in order to be then directly added to a java Sequence object. Currently can be used to build key signature meta message, program change message, track tempo meta message, note on events and note off events.
    Author:
    Tristano Tenaglia

      static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createKeySignature(java.lang.String keysig, java.lang.String quality, long lTick)
      Creates a MIDI meta message for key signature and key mode given the MEI attributes key.sig = keysig and key.mode = quality.

      Creates a NOTE_OFF MidiEvent given a pitch, tick and channel.

      Creates a NOTE_ON MidiEvent given a pitch, tick and channel.

      Creates a Program Change MidiEvent given an event, a tick and a channel.

      Creates a MIDI meta message for time signature and key mode given the MEI attributes meter.count = meterCount and meter.unit = meterUnit.

    • Method Detail

      • createTimeSignature

        public static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createTimeSignature(java.lang.String meterCount,
                                                             java.lang.String meterUnit,
                                                             long lTick)
                                                      throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Creates a MIDI meta message for time signature and key mode given the MEI attributes meter.count = meterCount and meter.unit = meterUnit.
        Parameters:
        meterCount - metercount attribute from mei
        meterUnit - meterunit attribute from mei
        lTick - Tick placement of this key signature
        Returns:
        The appropriate time signature midi meta message
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Throws an exception if the MIDI is invalid.

      • timeSignatureToByteArray

        public static byte[] timeSignatureToByteArray(java.lang.String meterCount,
                                              java.lang.String meterUnit)
        Converts MEI meter.count and meter.unit to a byte array for MIDI time signature meta message. Implemented as per the specification of: http://www.recordingblogs.com/sa/Wiki/topic/MIDI-Time-Signature-meta-message
        Parameters:
        meterCount - The number of unit notes per measure.
        meterUnit - The value of the unit note (e.g. 4 = quarter note...)
        Returns:
        An appropriate byte array represenation of the given time signature.

      • createKeySignature

        public static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createKeySignature(java.lang.String keysig,
                                                            java.lang.String quality,
                                                            long lTick)
                                                     throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Creates a MIDI meta message for key signature and key mode given the MEI attributes key.sig = keysig and key.mode = quality.
        Parameters:
        keysig - keysig attribute from mei
        quality - quality/keymode attribute from mei
        lTick - tick placement of this key signature
        Returns:
        the appropriate key signature midi meta message
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Throws an exception if the MIDI is invalid.

      • keysigToByteArray

        public static byte[] keysigToByteArray(java.lang.String keysig,
                                       java.lang.String quality)
        Converts MEI key.sig and key.mode to a byte array for MIDI key signature meta message.
        Parameters:
        keysig - key signature from mei data
        quality - key quality from mei data
        Returns:
        MIDI key signature data bytes

      • createProgramChange

        public static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createProgramChange(int pEvent,
                                                             long lTick,
                                                             int nChannel)
                                                      throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Creates a Program Change MidiEvent given an event, a tick and a channel.
        Parameters:
        pEvent - midi integer for instrument in program change
        lTick - tick at which this program change occurs
        nChannel - channel in which this program change occurs
        Returns:
        the appropriate program change midi event
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Throws an exception if the MIDI is invalid.

      • createTrackTempo

        public static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createTrackTempo(int bpm,
                                                          long lTick)
                                                   throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Input bpm (beats per minute) and starting tick and returns a MidiEvent MetaMessage of the given bpm tempo. This should be placed at the start of a track or on a tempo change.
        Parameters:
        bpm - beats per minute integer value that track tempo is changing to
        lTick - midi tick at which this track tempo changes
        Returns:
        the appropriate midi event track tempo meta message
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Throws an exception if the MIDI is invalid.

      • bpmToByteArray

        public static byte[] bpmToByteArray(int bpm)
        Convert beats per minute (bpm) to a byte array based on http://www.recordingblogs .com/sa/tabid/88/Default.aspx?topic=MIDI+Set+Tempo+meta+message. Will return new byte[]{(byte) 0x00} if bpm = 0. Will pad on zeros if hex string conversion has odd length.
        Parameters:
        bpm - beats per minute
        Returns:
        appropriate byte array given the bpm, 0 if bpm is 0

      • createNoteOnEvent

        public static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createNoteOnEvent(int nPitch,
                                                           long lTick,
                                                           int nChannel)
                                                    throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Creates a NOTE_ON MidiEvent given a pitch, tick and channel. Right now default velocity is 64.
        Parameters:
        nPitch - pitch of midi note
        lTick - tick at which midi note occurs
        nChannel - channel on which midi note occurs
        Returns:
        appropriate note on midi event
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Throws an exception if the MIDI is invalid.

      • createNoteOnEventVel

        public static javax.sound.midi.MidiEvent createNoteOnEventVel(int nPitch,
                                                              long lTick,
                                                              int nChannel,
                                                              int vel)
                                                       throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Creates a NOTE_ON MidiEvent given a pitch, tick and channel. Right now default velocity is 64.
        Parameters:
        nPitch - pitch of midi note
        lTick - tick at which midi note occurs
        nChannel - channel on which midi note occurs
        vel - velocity of the note on event to be created
        Returns:
        appropriate note on midi event
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Throws an exception if the MIDI is invalid.
